content.description:
RNLR 5.5 ** (70') F (6b)

A "Really Nice Little Route", sport climb, that is a good safe first lead with interesting route finding challenges. Beginning at the end of the face left of the obvious "Cornflake" crack, follow the bolts and lower sloping ramp/corner to step left and onto the upper face. The crux is near the top below the 3 bolt anchor.
content.location: Beginning at the end of the face left of the obvious "Cornflake" crack, climb up the lower sloping ramp/corner to the upper face.

content.description:
LITTLE LAZY 5.7 * (25') M(1b)

The right side of the small face on the left of the main lower cliff directly below the big fir tree (and 3 bolt anchor). Climb the obvious clean and sharp crack (harder if short).
content.protection: mixed, a couple of nuts and 1 bolt.
content.location: The right side of the small face on the left of the main lower cliff directly below the big fir tree (and 3 bolt anchor)

content.description:
LITTLE CRAZY 5.8* (30') M (3b)

Climbs the left arete of the little face to the left of the main lower cliff. 3 bolt anchor on top.
content.protection: mixed, 3 bolts and a couple of gear placements
content.location: the little face left of the main lower cliff face

content.description:
KISS 5.2 * (60') M(1b)

Takes the corner line up the left side of the west face of the Lower cliff. Climb the low angled right facing corner to the bolt protected crux step-up. Chain anchors on top... keep it simple...
content.location: Takes the corner line up the left side of the west face of the Lower cliff.

content.description:
CORNFLAKE 5.6 ** (15') G

A fun climb up the obvious clean crack at the far right end of the lower cliff/bouldering area. 3 bolt anchor on top.
content.location: far right end of the bouldering area.
